title: Volition
author: Volition
content: I have had three messages deleted now with no explanation as to why. I'd like to find the rules to help mitigate this but am not seeing them.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Firstly I let me get your question clear. Was it your replies on thread that were deleted? If yes, then it might have been the thread has been deleted probably by the author of the or moderators. Messages aren’t sent for threads that are deleted because it could be a whole lot of work for the mods. You receive notifications of reply been deleted only when it was just yours. If this doesn’t answer your question you can ask it more clearer.Here is the link for the forum rules  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0. It is pinned on the board

comments.body: Quote from: Volition on March 29, 2023, 06:19:59 PMI have had three messages deleted now with no explanation as to why. And your posts have been deleted because it was most probably not related to topics or like spam. If you post according to the rules hope your posts won't be deleted. It is pinned on the boardYou can also follow this thread as it's very helpful to newbies.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Visit Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQAccording to rule number 32, making multiple posts in a row is not allowed and that's why your posts were deleted. Quote from: mprep on July 21, 2014, 05:27:51 PM32. Posting multiple posts in a row (excluding bumps and reserved posts by the thread starter) is not allowed.I just visited your post history. There are some other posts that should be deleted too. You have made 4 posts in a row in this thread.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: "A reply of yours, quoted below, was deleted by a Bitcoin Forum moderator. Posts are most frequently deleted because they are off-topic, though they can also be deleted for other reasons. In the future, please avoid posting things that need to be deleted."This is a general reason for posts getting deleted. The rules contain other reasons, but majority of them can be summed to being spam or off-topic.To avoid posting things that needs to be deleted do more reading. You should familiarize with the rules before you create threads and replies.- Jay -

comments.author: superman184
comments.body: Quote from: Volition on March 29, 2023, 06:19:59 PMI have had three messages deleted now with no explanation as to why. I'd like to find the rules to help mitigate this but am not seeing them. For forum rules, which you can read carefully, actually pinned them on each sub-forum long ago and anyone can read them without having to ask. But if you want to see more complete forum rules besides this one Newbies - Read before posting. You can see and read it here Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ.There are many points written there and I think you just need to read then understand it very well. I hope this helps.

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: There are several reasons to why your reply and comments might get deleted and one major ret is repeating or writing similar multiple responses on a thread and another is writing off topic responses on a thread and this is a clear sign that you came to the forum all by your side and you should try as much as possible to improve your post quality and quantity as well as not be in a haste to write a post but rather take your time to read more so you could make meaningful contributions when the time to write comes.Please take things easy on yourself and don't make it seem you have lots of rules to follow as here is more like a community, hence you should be free and busy simply avoid plagiarism and make sure you reference every work not written originally by you.

comments.author: Volition
comments.body: Thank you for the responses everyone, very helpful, I'll read up on the rules and guidelines.

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: Volition on March 29, 2023, 06:19:59 PMI have had three messages deleted now with no explanation as to why. I'd like to find the rules to help mitigate this but am not seeing them. While you have been furnished with the links to the forum rules. I wish to let you understand that the forum doesn't have strict rules, if you can avoid spamming, plagiarism and cheating of any kind you will succeed here.For your post deletion, it could be that you have posted successively without allowing anyone post. If you do so the moderator will merge your post and get the unwanted deleted. Calm and you will understand with time, every newbies probably faced same fate.

comments.body: Quote from: Volition on March 29, 2023, 06:19:59 PMI have had three messages deleted now with no explanation as to why. I'd like to find the rules to help mitigate this but am not seeing them. You should have made it clear what you actually wanted to know, your comment has nothing to do with your topic. It is not clear what forum rules you are asking about.QuoteRe: Where can I find the forum rules? Are you wondering where I can find the forum rules for your topic?The answer to this question is that the topics pinned to the top of the section in which you post are the rules of that section. You read the topics well and then post.But you want to know your comments why your posts are deleted? There are many reasons for post deletion which have already been mentioned by many. Generally, if your posts are irrelevant and outside the forum rules, the posts will be deleted without any notification to you.Make sure you regularly post active and follow forum rules and share relevant information to ensure your post won't get deleted.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: New users always found it difficult to start at Bitcointalk. because it's a forum, and modern youth tend to use social media layouts that are more user-friendly, which I know BTT is not to some extent. Newcomers to Facebook and Instagram quickly learn how to use them because they know what they'll see and what their purpose is. But most people do not know how the forum works.Before making some posts, I think reading the rules is necessary, and, dear OP, you can read all the rules and regulations from the help tab, including what is what and how things work on BTT. Your account might be banned due to many factors, like instant bans only due to the usage of plagiarism content or if you are using AI tools and directly copying and pasting here. which harms the BTT's reputation because the internet is full of content, 90% of which is trash. That's why on the BTT, everything should be legit and contribute to the community or the community's members. I am not mentioning the same rules that previous members have already mentioned like Zaguru12 and hosseinimr93You should also try tools like the Telegram notifier, which makes you more active whenever someone mentions you. A notification will be shown on your Telegram handle. BitcoinTalk Notification BOT or you can use this guide to for more ease. How TryNinja's Notifier Bot Can Make your life easier. This forum is filled with wonders, the more time you spend on it the more you will explore and the more you will learn about BTC and how much this forum has contributed to the origin of BTC.
